column2: Lexi Rivera is a content creator with over 50 million followers across all social media platforms and over 15 million subscribers on YouTube.

Pesto Studios, the production company behind chef and social media megastar Nick DiGiovanni, is looking to hire a full-time Social Media Editor for Nick&rsquo
This role will handle vertical content for Nick&rsquo
column2: s Instagram, TikTok and YouTube accounts.

column1: This role is fully remote, but there's a possibility for hybrid work if the candidate is located in the Boston area.

column2: We are looking for an experienced, creative and resourceful Social Media Editor to handle all post-production for Nick DiGiovanni&rsquo

column2: Your primary responsibility will be to create engaging viral videos from raw footage based on provided concepts, scripts and brand guidelines.
You have a strong understanding of editing techniques, video production (especially post-production) and industry terminology. You follow social media trends and love all things pop culture.
Bonus - you have a passion for food and working in the food space!

As a Social Media Editor, you will directly support Nick DiGiovanni and work closely with his team, including his entire digital team (videographers, editors, producers etc), external team (talent agent, PR team etc) and other stakeholders involved in our videos.
You may also work with various other lighting, set design and camera crews.
3+ years of experience in video editing for social media (Instagram, TikTok, YouTube or other relevant platforms)
Expertise with Adobe Premiere, After Effects and Photoshop
Deep understanding of the mechanics behind viral short-form content (hooks, retention, storytelling, pacing etc)
Passion for pop culture and knowledge of the latest social media trends (particularly on vertical platforms)
Top-notch organizational skills and a strong ability to multitask
Ability to work in a collaborative, fast-paced environment and bring new creative ideas to the table

column1: Julius Dein,"Are you an EXPERT video editor and PASSIONATE about social media?! If so, what are you waiting for? Join the team of one of the biggest social media creators on the internet!üåè
Youtube Video Editors for the JD Studios team edit videos for our social media network of over 70 million followers and are responsible for turning raw clips into content that can go VIRAL!
You live and breathe social media and can easily spend hours watching videos online.
You are up to date and have an eye for viral content, creators, and what's popping.
You're top of your game when editing video content, and a dab hand with Premier Pro.
You are eager to learn and want to be a part of a top social media team.
You have an impeccable work ethic, a passion for social content, and a sense of humour.

You will be guided by some of the biggest internet creators on the planet, producing trending content with a quick turnaround. If you are looking for a job where you can express your creativity through video editing, this job is for you.
You are definitely a match if you...
Are fluent in English, with impeccable grammar and punctuation skills.
Have enthusiasm for video editing and social media content.
Previous experience working with social media content.
Have excellent video editing skills using software such as Adobe Premiere Pro.
Have a thorough understanding of the different social media platforms.
Understand storytelling on social media, and what makes an engaging, shareable story.
Have experience working to strict deadlines and targets.
If this sounds like you then what are you waiting for!?
Able to design attractive thumbnails, graphics, and decks.
This role is fully remote, with the option to occasionally join on content trips.
Do not apply for this job unless you are PASSIONATE about social media content, a MASTER of video/social media editing, and speak English at a B2 level or above.

We have a HIGHLY COMPETITIVE application process looking for the best social editors worldwide who can seamlessly use their editing software to create viral content, so only apply if you fit all of these criteria!",Video Editor,NULL,NULL,NULL,3500,month,"Challenges, Comedy, Entertainment, IRL, Lifestyle & Vlogs, Travel","Audience Retention, Color Grading, Filming, Podcast & Audio Recording",Slack,"Facebook, Instagram, Snapchat, TikTok, YouTube","Energetic, Fast-Paced, Funny, High Production","https://www.youtube.com/shorts/I062kjOI_O8, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ny5pAY7quFQ&t=124s&ab_channel=JuliusDeinVlogs"

We're looking for an experienced talking head writer who's interested in our topic &
Healthy Holistic Homes is all about what goes into creating a healthy living environment and how to create one. So it's about non-toxic living, family, relationships &

column1: If this sounds like you, here's what you need:

Mitchell Summers,"

Looking for a place that will ignite your passion for video editing? Summers Media is a company that has over 1 million followers on Facebook a couple of Snapchat shows with millions of views, and we're on the hunt for a skilled Video Editor to join our dynamic team for a full-time position. If you have a knack for storytelling through visuals, an eye for detail, and a desire to make a global impact, this role could be your perfect fit.

column2: Editing compelling video content that captivates diverse audiences that are around 3 minutes long.&nbsp
Transforming raw footage into polished, engaging videos that align with the project's vision.
Collaborating closely with our creative team to ensure seamless integration of visuals and narrative.
Staying up-to-date with industry trends and techniques to continually elevate our video content.

column1: If this sounds like you, here's what you need:

column2: Proficiency in video editing software (preferably Final Cut Pro).
Strong attention to detail and a keen eye for visual storytelling.
Ability to work both independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent organizational and time management skills to meet project deadlines.
Experience with color correction and audio editing is advantageous.
Knowledge of motion graphics and animation is a plus.
A creative mindset with the ability to think outside the box.
We offer a vibrant working environment.
Enjoy the excitement of working on diverse and impactful projects.
Your creative input is valued, and you'll have the opportunity to shape the visual narrative.

We provide growth opportunities and the chance to advance your career in video editing!

column1: We are a successful and growing YouTube channel based in Los Angeles. We focus on family-friendly content like challenges, trends - building secret rooms, one color shopping, $1 vs $1,000, hide and seek, 24 hour challenges.
column2: Our edits are long and complex, and require a professional, experienced editor.

column1: You will be part of a team of several editors working to make each video. We appreciate experience with retention devices, trends, quick cuts, good music sense, and a sense of humor appropriate for kids and teens.
We also post Shorts, IG Reels, Snap, and TikToks, so experience with vertical/short form is helpful.
Please include a sample of your editing work and why you're interested in working with us.
Salary is variable depending on experience, with room to grow with us.

Thank you!

ABOUT CHANGING LIVES PRODUCTIONS:

Changing Lives Productions is the video production company of Dhar Mann Studios, aimed at creating positive content for the social media generation. Our short, motivational videos focused on life, business, and relationships receive over 1 Billion views monthly and have garnered over 40 Billion views on Facebook, YouTube, Instagram and TikTok. The team is led by Dhar Mann, a mission-driven entrepreneur with a global audience of over 100 Million social media followers and one of the highest viewed content creators in the world today. Our stories depict real life situations shown by actors that teach important life lessons. The company is driven by one founding principle: We‚Äôre not just telling stories, we‚Äôre changing lives.

One Day Entertainment (Yes Theory & Airrack),"

At One Day Entertainment, our mission is to provide fractional COO services to established creators who prefer not to engage with traditional management companies. Founded by Zack Honarvar, we've supported prominent creators like Yes Theory, Airrack, and the Cheeky Boyos, helping them launch numerous subsidiary businesses as their business partners &
column2:
co-founders.

What will you do?

  • Ensure timely and accurate payroll processing for multiple creator businesses. You will manage payroll schedules, handle discrepancies, and ensure all payments comply with legal and tax regulations.

  • Support creators in their hiring process, including drafting job descriptions, running interview processes, and managing onboarding. You will help build strong and effective teams by identifying talent, conducting interviews, and facilitating smooth transitions for new hires.

  • Work with our accountants to organize monthly financial reports, working closely with bookkeepers to maintain accurate and up-to-date financial records. You will track expenses, prepare budgets, and provide financial insights to help creators make informed decisions.

  • Work with our lawyers to create, organize, and maintain contracts for our clients, ensuring that all agreements are well-documented and easily accessible. You will manage contract renewals, terminations, and modifications, ensuring that all legal and business requirements are met.

  • Work directly with our creators to help them foster and manage their internal team culture to ensure a positive and productive work environment. You will develop and implement team-building activities, manage conflict resolution, and promote a collaborative and inclusive workplace.

  • Work directly with creators to identify and address any operational issues they may have. You will streamline daily activities and improve business processes to help our clients' businesses run smoothly and grow successfully.

We're looking for someone who:

  • Is passionate about empowering creators and supporting the creator economy.

  • Has experience in operations, finance, or other administrative roles, ideally within a dynamic and fast-paced environment.

  • Demonstrates strong organizational skills and attention to detail.

  • Is proficient in managing payroll, contracts, and financial documentation.

  • Can effectively coordinate with external professionals, including accountants and lawyers.

  • Excels in managing hiring processes and fostering team culture.

  • Is adaptable, proactive, and capable of managing multiple tasks simultaneously.

  • Is based in, or open to relocating to Los Angeles, CA. (Required)

About Us:

One Day Entertainment was founded in 2017 by Zack Honarvar, whose career includes significant contributions to the success of creators like Yes Theory, Airrack, and the Cheeky Boyos. Our focus is on providing fractional COO services, allowing creators to devote their energy to their craft while we handle the operational complexities of their businesses.

Currently, we primarily work with Airrack and Yes Theory, helping them scale their channels to billions of views and launch successful businesses in e-commerce, tech, CPG, and podcasting. In addition to our operational support, we assist creators with brand partnerships and special projects, ensuring they can capitalize on unique opportunities and expand their influence. By leveraging our expertise in operations and business development, we enable creators to achieve their goals without the constraints of traditional management structures.

Join us in our mission to help creators build their empires the right way.

Contact zack@onedayent.com for more information.

Strange Parts,"

Overview

We are looking for a highly motivated and experienced video producer to join the team at Strange Parts. As a producer, you will be responsible for managing the video production process from start to finish. This dynamic and fast-paced role requires strong organizational and project management skills, experience in video or film production (including pre and post-production), and a passion for technology and manufacturing. The job involves 50% travel to different factories for video shoots, often to unique and challenging parts of the world, particularly China. The other 50% of your time will be spent working remotely on pre-production and post-production tasks such as researching new factories and overseeing the editing and post-production process for completed shoots.

Company Overview

Strange Parts is a popular YouTube channel with almost 2 million subscribers that explores the ins and outs of manufacturing and technology. Known for its deep dives into difficult engineering projects, such as making a working iPhone from parts bought in the electronics markets in Shenzhen, the channel also provides behind-the-scenes looks at some of the most interesting and innovative factories around the world, particularly in China.

Key Responsibilities

  • Pre-production

    • Research and identify potential shoot locations (primarily factories currently)

    • Contact and negotiate shoots with factory representatives as the primary point of contact.

    • Organize travel and accommodation logistics.

    • Hire and manage freelance staff (camera operators, fixers, translators, etc.).

  • Production:

    • Oversee shoot logistics and maintain the schedule.

    • Take notes during shoots and communicate shot details and artistic vision to the editing team.

    • Handle all on-location issues, working with factory representatives, to ensure a smooth shoot.

  • Manage post production:

    • Manage footage backups and delivery of footage to editors.

    • Oversee the editing and finishing process, ensuring both the continuity of artistic vision between the host, camera operator, editors, and thumbnail artists and the quality of the final product.

    • Manage the post production schedule, ensuring that videos are released on time.

    • Manage uploads, posts and releases on multiple video and social media platforms.

    • Ensure all content meets the high standards and overall style of Strange Parts.

Requirements

  • The ideal candidate for this position will have a minimum of 3 years experience as a youtube, reality tv, or documentary producer with experience in international shoots and a run and gun style of shooting. A portfolio of previous work is required for consideration.

  • Candidates must have experience operating in China and must speak at least ‚Äúsurvival level‚Äù Mandarin. This includes being able to order food, get around in a taxi, and barter in a market without relying on your phone. Higher levels of fluency are a big plus.

  • The position requires 50% travel, worldwide, for up to 4 weeks per trip, and 50% remote work (digital nomads welcome). Locations will initially be focused on mainland China, Asia, and the US. For your application to be accepted, please include in your cover letter that you understand these travel requirements.

  • Candidates must hold a US passport or have the legal right to work in the US.

  • Solid travel experience in 3rd world countries is required.

  • The ideal candidate will be a natural relationship builder who loves meeting new people and building relationships quickly, as well as organizing groups of people to do cool, ambitious projects.

  • Candidates must be detail oriented and have strong organizational, project management, and leadership/management skills, as well as the ability to adapt to changes in fast-paced environments.

  • A background in or passion for manufacturing, engineering, making, and/or technology is strongly preferred.

  • Understanding of cultural nuances and sensitivities when working in diverse international environments.

  • Ability to handle the physical demands of on-site production, including carrying equipment and working long hours.

Benefits

  • Travel to unique and interesting locations.

  • Work from anywhere when we‚Äôre not shooting.

  • Collaborative and creative work environment

  • Competitive pay, based on experience

  • Health and travel insurance

Carter Kench,"

Carter is looking for a rockstar producer to help level up his new Halloween YouTube series. We're aiming for a 3 to 4 part series focused on Carter building a Haunted House for his friends and then recording their reactions as they go through it.

We're seeing this as somewhere between the TV show ""Wipe Out"" and viral videos of celebrities walking through larger haunted houses. We're aiming to delight the viewers, and only scare the participants going through the haunted house.

We're looking for someone who is:

- Spirited, Absolutely obsessed with Halloween, Haunted Houses and Horror Movies
- LA based
- Has experience budgeting/line producing, and project managing
- Capable of sourcing and hiring additional vendors for lighting, equipment, set design, props
column2:
has a wide network of capable vendors

This is a one-off project, but has potential to turn into a long term partnership.

column1:
Michael Ligier,"

Overview:

We are looking to hire a full-time or part-time Long-Form Youtube Video Editor to handle all post-production work for Michael Ligier's long-form videos.

Michael Ligier is one of the largest food and restaurant creators in the world amassing 4.5 million followers across platforms, is a TasteHunter for the World's 50 Best Restaurants, and has worked with most of the top restaurants around the world as well. He focuses on highlighting the most amazing food whether it's magical scientific creations in his kitchen or going to some of the most exclusive restaurants.
column2:
This is a fully remote role with the opportunity for a hybrid role in San Francisco if applicable. The job can be part-time or full-time. If full-time, will include health insurance benefits covered.

Who We're Looking For

The ideal person for this role is someone with a strong understanding of editing techniques and video production/post production. It's also someone who follows social media and pop culture trends and can translate their learnings into these videos. Bonus if you've already created food/restaurant videos before and/or have a passion for working in the food space!

The goal is to create some of the most beautiful, awe-inspiring, and viral food videos on the internet so your
column3:
primary reponsibility will be to create engaging videos from raw footage based on concepts, scripts, and brand guidelines.

What You Bring to the Team

  • Deep understanding of the mechanics behind long-form content (hooks, retention, storytelling, pacing etc)

  • Passion for pop culture and knowledge of the latest social media trends

  • Top-notch organizational skills and a strong ability to multitask

  • Ability to work in a collaborative, fast-paced environment and bring new creative ideas to the table

Charlotte Dobre,"

Charlotte Dobre is expanding, and we are looking for an organized individual to join our team as a Channel Manager.

As a channel manager, you would be expected to do the following:

  • Review, upload videos to the channel, and perform copyright checks (you will need a strong internet connection to download/upload 4k videos to YouTube)

  • Quality control of videos

  • Community management

  • Managing employees, various admin tasks

  • Licensing contracts

Experience/Knowledge in video editing, photoshop, SEO, and thumbnail making is an asset but not a requirement.

The job would be P/T, can work remote
